author: Somesh Jha
text:
The facility enables workers to transfer PF deposits easily while switching jobs

The Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation has won the National Award on e-Governance 2015-16 for launching the Universal Account Number (UAN) facility which enables workers to transfer their provident fund deposits while switching jobs easily. The EPFO won the gold award in the ‘innovative use of technology in e-governance’ category and the retirement body will get a cash prize of Rs. 2 lakh.

“It is heartening to know that the e-initiatives of EPFO are getting recognised by the Union government as well. Our ultimate goal is to deliver services as smooth as an e-bank,” said K.K. Jalan, Central Provident Fund Commissioner at the EPFO.

The award will be presented by the Ministry of Personnel, Public Grievances and Pensions to the EPFO at the 19th National Conference on e-governance to be held in Nagpur on January 22. Through UAN, active employees are provided a universal number which can be linked to various provident fund account numbers provided to them while working in different organisations. A single account number can be used through all of workers’ employments with various organisations. Earlier, the worker had to apply for transfer of funds on change of job.
title: EPFO bags e-governance award for UAN
